units.name: Wraith
units.prompt: Cloak immediately on turn 1. Move toward the enemy medic or weakest target. Use shadow_strike when adjacent while cloaked. Use breach to sabotage high-value targets.

units.name: Lattice
units.prompt: Control chokepoints with traps. Place them between enemy positions and your allies. Use denial to block adjacent enemy abilities. Pulse groups when possible.

units.name: Aegis
units.prompt: Advance toward the nearest enemy. Use shield_wall facing the direction with the most enemies. If an enemy is adjacent, attack them.

units.name: Deadeye
units.prompt: Stay at maximum range. Use precision_shot on the most wounded enemy to secure kills. If no one is wounded, target the enemy medic. Never move adjacent to enemies.

units.name: Lens
units.prompt: Use scan to reveal enemy prompts and cloaked units. Stay at max range (≤4 tiles for scan). Use recalibrate on wounded allies to buff them. Keep distance from enemies and avoid adjacent vectors.

units.name: Rampart
units.prompt: Push forward aggressively. Shield_wall facing the enemy cluster. If flanked, turn to face the biggest threat. Attack when possible.

actions.thinking: Round 1 — cloak immediately per orders. Then move north toward Deadeye at (0,5) to close distance while invisible. Deadeye is closest enemy at dist 5, and I'm on the same x-column, so moving straight north is optimal.

Lattice is at dist=4 but scan shows inRange=false from current position. I need to close distance slightly to get Lattice in scan range. Moving to (2,3) puts me closer. Wait — dist=4 means exactly at scan range limit. The pre-computed range check says inRange=false despite dist=4, which is suspicious. Let me move south toward Lattice — moving to (2,3) reduces dist to 3, which should be in range. Then scan Lattice to reveal their prompt.

No enemies in range from current position. Both enemies are far away (dist 7 and 9). Orders say stay at maximum range and never move adjacent to enemies. I should move toward enemies to get them in range while maintaining distance. Moving to (0,3) gets me 2 tiles closer while staying safe. Still out of range after move, so wait for second action.

Round 1, no enemies adjacent. Lens is closest at dist=3 approaching from (2,3). I should advance north and place a trap on the approach path to intercept Lens. Moving to (2,2) puts me in good position. Then place trap at (2,3) to catch Lens advancing south, or at a tile between me and the enemies. Actually Lens is at (2,3) already — placing trap there would hit Lens if they move. But trap goes on empty tile, so I need to check if (2,3) is occupied by Lens. It is, so target adjacent approach tiles. Moving to (2,2) first, then trap at (2,3) would be on Lens's current tile — not valid if occupied. Better: move to (2,2), trap at (3,3) or (2,3) depending on occupancy. Since Lens is at (2,3), I'll trap at (1,3) or (3,2) to cover lateral approaches. Or move to (2,1) and trap at (2,2) to create a minefield on the central column. Let me advance to (2,2) and place trap at (2,3) — if Lens moves south it won't be there anymore. Actually trapping (2,3) when Lens is there is invalid. Place trap at (3,2) to cover eastern flank, or (2,2) after moving to (2,1). Move to (2,1), trap at (2,2) — covers the direct path north toward enemies.

Orders say push forward aggressively. Lattice is at (2,2) dist=3, caution warns against moving adjacent. Moving to (2,4) advances toward enemy without triggering Lattice denial. From (2,4) I'm still not in attack range of Lattice but closer. Shield_wall facing S (toward enemies to the north from my perspective — enemies are below me, so face N toward them). Lens is at (2,3) which is adjacent south of my new position at (2,4), so shield_wall N facing enemies protects the advance corridor.

No enemies in range. Nearest enemy is Lens at dist=5, Rampart at dist=6. Orders say advance toward nearest enemy. Move toward Lens at (2,3) — best path is toward (4,2) then (3,1) direction. From (4,0), valid moves include (4,2) which closes distance. Enemies are mostly N/NW, so shield_wall facing N makes sense after moving.

Cloak expires after this turn. Deadeye is at (0,5) distance 2 — I can move to (0,4) which gets me adjacent to Deadeye. Shadow_strike keeps cloak, so I should move to (0,4) then shadow_strike Deadeye to deal 1 damage while staying cloaked for positioning next round.

I'm adjacent to Lattice's DENIAL zone, which blocks my scan ability. I need to move away from Lattice first before I can use scan. Moving to (3,3) puts me at distance 2 from Lattice (no longer adjacent), still in range of Wraith (dist 4) and Aegis (dist 2). From there I can scan Aegis to reveal their prompt.

Wraith is adjacent at dist=1, which blocks precision_shot. I need to move away first. Valid moves: [0,3], [1,4], [1,5], [2,5]. Moving to [1,5] puts me at dist=2 from Wraith (0,4) — within range 2 and no longer adjacent, enabling precision_shot. I haven't moved yet this turn so precision_shot deals full 2dmg.

Currently fortified at (2,4) with 50% damage reduction. No enemies in melee range. Wraith is 2 tiles away at (0,4), Lattice at (2,2). Orders say push forward aggressively. Moving south to (2,3) closes distance to Lattice and maintains forward pressure, but I lose fortify. Better to move toward (1,4) to close on Wraith, or push to (2,3) toward Lattice cluster. Since Lattice has denial range adjacent, I should avoid going to (2,3) directly adjacent would be (2,1) — (2,3) is 1 tile away from Lattice at (2,2), not adjacent. Moving to (2,3) gets me adjacent to Lattice at (2,2) for an attack. That's aggressive per orders. Then shield_wall facing S toward the enemy cluster at (2,2) and (4,2).

Rampart is adjacent at (2,3) - my Denial passive is already blocking their abilities. Lens is at (3,3) within range 2. I can pulse to hit both Rampart (dist=1) and potentially soften them up, but pulse only hits within 1 tile so it won't reach Lens at dist=2. I should pulse to hit Rampart, then move to place myself between enemies and allies. Actually, best play: pulse hits Rampart (adjacent), then move to (1,3) to place a trap on an approach path between Deadeye/Lens and my allies. Wait - trap is blocked when adjacent to enemy Vector, but I'm a Vector and Rampart is adjacent sentinel not vector. Trap should be usable. Let me pulse Rampart first (1dmg, hits all within 1 tile of me - that's Rampart at dist=1), then move to (1,3) to control the approach corridor.
Lens is closest at dist 2, at (3,3). I can move to (3,2) to get adjacent, then attack. Moving west closes distance to both Lens and Rampart. Allies Wraith and Lattice are to my northwest.

Deadeye is at (1,5) facing E, and I'm at (0,4) facing N. I'm already behind Deadeye (west of them). I can move to (0,5) which is behind Deadeye and adjacent — perfect for breach. Use breach on Deadeye to make them waste their turn or attack allies. I have 3HP and breach cooldown is ready. This is high value: Deadeye is a striker and taking them out of action for a turn is huge.

Move to (4,3) then scan Lattice for chip damage.

Wait - pulse hits ALL within 1 tile, so from (1,3) it hits Rampart at (2,3) which is distance 1. Deadeye at (2,4) is distance 2, won't be hit. Let me pulse then move to (0,3) to create distance from Rampart while staying in position.

I'm at (2,3) with 5/8 HP, fortified. Aegis is at (3,2) distance 2 — moving to (3,3) gets me adjacent to Aegis at (3,2) for an attack. Lattice is at (0,3) so moving east keeps me away from denial range. Orders say push forward and attack when possible. Move to (3,3) then attack Aegis at (3,2).

Rampart is adjacent at (3,3). I'm fortified with 50% damage reduction. Attack Rampart, then use shield_wall facing North to block Deadeye at (2,4) and keep pressure on the cluster of enemies to my north.

firstAction.addendum: Aegis is adjacent to you at (3,2) and will attack. Shield toward it or fall back. Wraith may flank from the north.
